titleStmt.title: Ottokar Ševčik
born Horažďovice (Bohemia), March 22, 1852; died Písek (Bohemia), January 18, 1934

publicationStmt.publisher: Schenker Documents Online in association with the Centre for Computing in the Humanities

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

div.p: Bohemian violinist, teacher of many famous violinists including Szymon Goldberg and Efrem Zimbalist; professor of the violin master school at the Vienna Academy for Music and Performing Art 1909–18.

div.head: Ševčik and Schenker
div.p: Ševčik is briefly mentioned in correspondence regarding Schenker’s attempt to form an Organization for Creative and Performing Musicians in Vienna in 1912. There is no known correspondence between the two men.
